instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: Connect a charger with the ISL removed on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi, I connected a charger with the [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/catalogsearch/result/?q=isl"]ISL[/URL] removed on an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. Since, when I connect a MagSafe charger, it's stop to give power to the board.

What's the conseqences of connectin a charger with the [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/catalogsearch/result/?q=isl"]ISL[/URL] removed ? Is it fixable iyp ?

threads.title: Connect a charger with the ISL removed on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Should do no damage. There will be no ACOK signal so the board won't work. It should be able to power from a battery without <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: Connect a charger with the ISL removed on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
